On Wednesday April 22nd and Thursday April 23rd 2020 from 8am-3pm we will have Senior book return, locker clean out and LGSD material return. Seniors will also be able to pick up projects that are completed in classes (art, woods, welding etc). Students will bring their items to the front doors of the high school and we will have lines that are marked for social distancing. Only a few students at a time will be allowed entry. Books will be checked in by staff, lockers will be emptied by staff and items will be returned to the student. Students will not be allowed to go to lockers or locker rooms. Please bring all items that need to be returned to the school on those days.

Seniors that still need to complete courses for graduation will check in books at a later date to be determined in the future.

There's a very strong correlation between good attendance and success in school. On the other hand, students who regularly miss school are also more likely to struggle in school.

Missed days add up quickly: Just two days a month puts a child's success in jeopardy because students fall behind and disconnect. By third grade, it gets much more difficult to catch up. Students who regularly miss school can quickly feel hopeless, and returning becomes harder and harder.

The reasons for chronic absenteeism are understandable but they must be addressed. Troubleshooting issues that are keeping a student away from school can make a difference immediately and for the long term. Students with solid attendance are much more likely to be successful during school and after graduation.
